Beau Watson
Recruitment Consultant - Data Science (Phoenix) at Harnham
SENIOR DIRECTOR OF DATA SCIENCEFULLY REMOTE190,000 - 200,000 + BONUS + EQUITYAre you ready to dive deep and lead a team of big-thinking data scientists in the travel industry? Do you have professional experience spearheading the development of predictive algorithms based on principles from statistics, machine learning, and analytical solutions? Do you have a passion for delivering efficiency gains with a bias for action and results? This travel-tech company is looking for an individual who is ready to take on the role of Senior Director of Data Science.THE COMPANY:This company functions in the travel-tech space with the goal of providing a richer, more rewarding business travel experience. They admire individuals with a creative, will-to-win mentality and customer obsession. In this role, you will help the growth of the company with your ability to direct a team through the generation and execution of problem statements, project management, as well as team growth.THE ROLE:This individual has a strong quantitative background in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Sciences, or Engineering. In this role, the Senior Director of Data Science will have a strong managerial mindset with the ability to do hands-on work when necessary.Grow and lead a team of data scientists through the design, building, synthesizing, and presentation of robust analysesMentor the professional development of direct reports, managers, and ICs through coaching and performance managementGather, organize and interpret structured and unstructured data from multiple internal and external sourcesProven ability to manage and present multiple projects and datasets for inter-team communication and stakeholdersDirecting product analytics and experimentation projectsTransformational leadership while being hands-on with 10% of the dataYOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Expert knowledge of a scientific computing language (such as Python or R) and SQLStrong applicable experience in statistics and machine learning, empowering organizations by making data as well-structured and self-serve as possiblePrevious experience working with product analytics and experimentation projectsLeadership experience with analytical and technical problem-solvingProven ability to lead projects to completion and collaborate seamlessly with othersA self-starter with the ability to operate effectively and with autonomy in a fast-paced environmentStrong communication skills to present to stakeholders with rigorous execution and high impactTHE BENEFITS:You can earn between $190,000 - $200,000 plus bonus, equity, a 401(k) plan with a matching program, medical coverage, and 100% paid dental and vision insurance.HOW TO APPLY:Please register your interest by sending your CV to Beau Watson via the Apply link on this page.
